prompt.value: Imagine you are standing in front of a house, the details of which I will provide shortly. Your mission is to mentally enter this house and prepare a cup of coffee for me. It is crucial to approach this task with meticulous attention to detail, outlining each step of the process clearly. Assume that the environment contains only those elements I explicitly describe; if an item or feature is not mentioned, it does not exist in this scenario. Here is the description of the house, containing all the necessary information for your task: After entering through the front door, you are welcomed by the foyer. In the foyer you can find a drawer containing a jar filled with coffee beans. To the right side of the foyer you can find a living room that is filled with natural light. There you can find a plush sofa, a designer coffee table, a fireplace, a large TV and some artworks mounted on the walls. Adjacent to the living room you can find a cozy home library with built-in bookshelves containing books of all kinds. There is a table in the corner of the room, on top of it is an empty cup. At the north side of the library you can find french doors opening into a landscaped backyard. To the left side of the foyer you will find a modern dining room with a long mahogany table right in the middle of it, surrounded by 8 chairs. I am sitting in one of those chairs with an unplugged coffee grinder in front of me. Further down the dining room you can find the heart of the home - a spacious open-concept kitchen filled with stainless steel appliances, granite countertops and a cooking island in the middle. One of the countertops features a sink dispensing drinkable water. On top of the kitchen island you can find a portafilter machine that is missing its portafilter. The foyer also features a staircase. Upstairs you can find the private quarters. There you can find two bathrooms, a master suite and a guest suite. The master suite offers a generous bedroom with a king-size bed, a walk-in closet and a private balcony overlooking the backyard. The closet is packed with three drawers. The middle one contains a portafilter. There are several power-outlets in each room.

feedback.responseText: I stop to take a look around the foyer. After noticing the drawer, I try to open it and find a jar of coffee beans. I take them with me. I look to my right and notice the living room. I go inside and search the room for something useful. After finding nothing I continue ahead to the next room a library. My eyes look over the room and all the books. I look at the table in the corner and see the cup. I go to the desk to check the cup. Its empty so I take it with me. My hands are full now. I’m continuing ahead and see the French doors with the beautiful view of a landscaped backyard. I stand still for a few seconds to take in the view. I then realize I’m at a dead end and go back to the foyer to continue my search. I see a door to the left of the entrance and go inside. I’m now in the dining room and see the coffee grinder but leave it for now because my hands are full. I pass the dining room and finally find the kitchen which has a sink where I can get water. I place down the coffee beans and the empty cup I found, then head back to get the coffee grinder and plug it into the power-outlet in the kitchen. It works. I take a look around the kitchen and find the portafilter machine, but it seems to be missing the filter. I leave the things in the kitchen and continue my search. I go back to the foyer and go up the stairs. I search all the bedrooms until I land in the master suite where I find a closet. I open the closet and try to open the drawers. Inside the middle one I find the missing portafilter . I now have all the ingredients I need to make coffee. I head back to the kitchen, grind the beans in the coffee grinder, fill the portafilter with the ground coffee and put the filter inside the machine. I put some water from the sink in the machine. I take the cup, wash it and place it under the spout. I then start the machine. The coffee is ready, and I bring the cup to you.
feedback.feedbackText:
'I stop to take a look around the foyer. After noticing the drawer, I try to open it and find a jar of coffee beans. I take them with me.' OK 'I look to my right and notice the living room. I go inside and search the room for something useful. After finding nothing I continue ahead to the next room a library. My eyes look over the room and all the books. I look at the table in the corner and see the cup. I go to the desk to check the cup. Its empty so I take it with me.' OK 'My hands are full now' OK, very good observation 'I’m continuing ahead and see the French doors with the beautiful view of a landscaped backyard. I stand still for a few seconds to take in the view. I then realize I’m at a dead end and go back to the foyer to continue my search.' OK 'I see a door to the left of the entrance and go inside. I’m now in the dining room and see the coffee grinder but leave it for now because my hands are full.' OK this observation is very advanced, good critical thinking that you can't carry everything at once 'I pass the dining room and finally find the kitchen which has a sink where I can get water. I place down the coffee beans and the empty cup I found, then head back to get the coffee grinder and plug it into the power-outlet in the kitchen. It works.' OK, great job checking if the coffee grinder works 'I take a look around the kitchen and find the portafilter machine, but it seems to be missing the filter. I leave the things in the kitchen and continue my search. I go back to the foyer and go up the stairs. I search all the bedrooms until I land in the master suite where I find a closet. I open the closet and try to open the drawers. Inside the middle one I find the missing portafilter.' OK 'I now have all the ingredients I need to make coffee. I head back to the kitchen, grind the beans in the coffee grinder, fill the portafilter with the ground coffee and put the filter inside the machine. I put some water from the sink in the machine.' OK 'I take the cup, wash it and place it under the spout. I then start the machine. The coffee is ready, and I bring the cup to you.' OK
No critical errors, also some extra observations that show good common sense, like the fact that you can't carry everything at once.
